tool_description: Analyzes pigment and binding medium composition through non-invasive spectroscopic techniques to determine materials used and assess historical accuracy.

sampling_method.description: Analysis method (XRF, FTIR, Raman, visual spectroscopy)

reference_database.description: Historical pigment database to compare against

calibration_standards.description: Whether to use calibration standards for accuracy

multiple_readings.description: Take multiple readings per location for reliability

historical_period.description: Expected historical period for pigment comparison

binding_medium_analysis.description: Include analysis of binding medium composition

contamination_check.description: Check for modern contamination or restoration materials

error_messages: Invalid artwork_id: Provide a valid artwork identifier from metadata record.
Unsupported sampling method: Use one of [XRF, FTIR, Raman, visual spectroscopy].
Too many test locations: Maximum 15 locations can be analyzed in single session.
Empty test locations: Must specify at least one color area to analyze.
Instrument calibration error: Spectroscopic equipment requires calibration before use.
Invalid reference database: Specify valid historical pigment database.
Environmental conditions unstable: Temperature and humidity must be stable for accurate analysis.
usage: Specify artwork, analysis method, and test locations. Tool performs spectroscopic analysis to identify pigments and binding media, comparing results to historical databases.

pigment_identifications.description: Identified pigments for each test location

historical_accuracy.description: Assessment of whether materials match expected historical period

modern_materials_detected.description: Whether any modern or anachronistic materials were found

binding_medium_results.description: Analysis results for binding medium composition

confidence_levels.description: Confidence percentages for each pigment identification
